required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of a New Open Source Virtual Bronchoscope Navigation System
clinical_study.official_title: Fraxinus- Assessment of an Open Source Virtual Bronchoscopic Navigation System

lead_sponsor.agency: Norwegian University of Science and Technology

clinical_study.source: Norwegian University of Science and Technology

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate the feasibility of the Fraxinus Virtual Bronchoscope Navigation (VBN) System in the bronchoscopic access to target lesions. The study emphasizes the system´s efficacy in diagnostics of peripheral pulmonary lesions and the ease of use for the operator.

detailed_description.textblock: Multi-center study. The study explores Fraxinus which is an open source, software only, simple guiding system for bronchoscopy. The system provides 3D maps with centerline-to-target information extracted from preoperative computed tomography. The ability of the system to guide a user to a peripheral target lesion will be evaluated. During bronchoscopy any established method for diagnostic sampling is allowed. User Evaluation will be essential to decide if the Fraxinus VBN System is beneficial in a clinical setting.

primary_outcome.measure: Evidence if the Fraxinus VBN System has a role in the assessment of peripheral pulmonary lesions
primary_outcome.description: The proportion of cases in which the use of the system is considered beneficial

secondary_outcome.description: Diagnostic success defined as cytology or biopsy with pathology
Time spent with preparations and bronchoscopy
Procedure related adverse events or unexpected incidents registrated
Enquiry on main operator´s experience after end of bronchoscopy

intervention.description: Open source planning tool for bronchoscopy

study_pop.textblock: Patents with undiagnosed peripheral pulmonary lesion(s) who have been recommended for bronchoscopy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- referred to thoracic department in any of the participating hospitals with undiagnosed peripheral pulmonary lesion(s) not visible by bronchoscopy
- voluntary signed an informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- pregnancy
- Any patient that the Investigator feels is not appropriate for this study for any reason

overall_official.affiliation: Norwegian University of Science and Technology
